article.headline: Dwayne âThe Rockâ Johnson and his family tested positive for coronavirus
article.body: Dwayne Johnson speaks during the Universal Pictures presentation at CinemaCon 2019 in April 2019. Associated Press LOS ANGELES â Dwayne âThe Rockâ Johnson shared some unfortunate news on his home front: He and his family tested positive for the coronavirus. Johnson announced their diagnosis in an 11-plus minute video onÂ InstagramÂ on Wednesday. He said he was shocked after hearing their positive tests, calling the ordeal âone of the most challenging and difficult things weâve ever had to endure.â var instagramAPI="https://api.instagram.com/oembed?url=http://instagr.am/p/CEppiNRlpvs&hidecaption=false"; var xhr=new XMLHttpRequest(); xhr.open('GET',instagramAPI);xhr.send(null);xhr.onreadystatechange=function(){ var DONE=4;var OK=200;if(xhr.readyState===DONE){if(xhr.status===OK) var respJSON=JSON.parse(xhr.responseText); var instgramHTML=respJSON.html; var embed_target=document.querySelectorAll("[data-instagramid='CEppiNRlpvs']"); embed_target[0].innerHTML=instgramHTML; window.instgrm.Embeds.process(); }else{console.log('Error loading instagram embed: '+xhr.status); }}; The actor said he along with his wife, Lauren Hashian, and two young daughters contracted the virus, but have now recovered. He said his daughters âbounced backâ after having sore throats for a couple days. But for Johnson and his wife, he said they both had a ârough go.â Johnson said he and his family caught the virus from close family friends, who told him they did not know where they contracted the virus. Johnson said the ordeal has made him more conscious. He made several suggestions to combat the virus such as wearing a mask, boost your immune system and commit to wellness.
